name: Cooperative Intelligence in Mixed-Motive Text-Mediated Environments
description: Develop autonomous language model agents capable of cooperative intelligence in mixed-motive, text-mediated environments. Agents must navigate complex social scenarios requiring reasoning, communication, and decision-making skills while balancing individual goals with collective welfare.

cr:input.name: competition_dataset
cr:input.description: Dataset consists of diverse, open-ended scenarios generated using the Concordia framework. Scenarios include natural language descriptions of the game state, agent actions, and GM-generated event outcomes. Example inputs include: 'The fishery is overharvested; propose a solution,' or 'Village elder A offers 10 units of gold for treaty compliance.'

cr:output.name: agent_responses
cr:output.description: Free-form natural language descriptions of the agent's intended actions or responses. Example outputs include: 'I propose reducing fishing quotas to ensure sustainability,' or 'I accept the treaty terms and offer 5 units of gold as compensation.'

field.name: scenario_id
field.description: Unique identifier for the scenario, e.g., scenario_001

field.name: response
field.description: Agent's free-form response to the scenario

cr:evaluation.notes: Cooperative intelligence score is calculated using an LM-based reward model. Social welfare outcomes are computed using various welfare functions derived from GM-determined outcomes.

open_questions: What is the exact format of the dataset (e.g., JSON, CSV)?
What are the token limits for input/output per round?
What are the exact computation limits for LM calls per round?
What is the URL for the dataset?
What are the specific welfare functions used for social welfare score computation?
fill_in_the_blank: cr:input[0].url - dataset URL not specified in paper
cr:execution.allowedExternalData - external data usage rules not specified
open_questions[1] - token limits for input/output not specified
open_questions[2] - LM call limits not specified
open_questions[4] - specific welfare functions not described
